result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to meet with the payment clerk.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From DE at 3 pm stating she cannot get her pymt to go through online.  Ret'd call to DE & left a v/m stating her pymt is due immediately as she will be warranted for non pymt any day now.  DE was advised to enter in any future court date if she cannot get her pymt to process due to this portion or the DE must return my call immediately. jaf

Order for payment at 11-16-2015 01:30 pm
DE was mailed a copy to her house & also to the SCC Jail this date. jaf

From DE in writing.  DE to pay $25/mo comm 11-15-15 (Aug - Oct pymts deferred).  DE will be mailed a new Order for Pymt.  DE also advised to submit new request or sign new PPlan if she is still incarcerated at that time.  jaf
Filed by Def. Requesting more time to pay. km
c: Def, Atty, DA, HPD & Jail. eif
DE appeared.  DE to pay $25/mo comm 7-15-15.  $15 Pplan Fee added.  DE signed Pplan Agmt. jaf
c: Def & Atty. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff appeared. Case called at 10:17 am. There is an agreement. Atty Caton recites agreement. Count #1 to be amended to 943.23(2)(a) Mis. Theft. No objection from ADA Correll. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of amended count 1. Court orders:
- 2 days jail, credit for time served
- Court Costs $243.00; Payable on a payment plan
Status conference on June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

CO: TCH for SRN, RPT: Kasten, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff appeared. Court questions Defendant. Court confirms address. Court quashes stayed warrant. Bond continues in form and amount.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Return on warrant on May 28, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

CO: CA Richards for Judge Vlack, REP: Drost, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff did not appear. Case called at 10:43 a.m. Atty Caton has not reached client. ADA Nieskes requests warrant stayed. Adjoining states only on extradition and $250 cash. Court will order warrant and stay until 05-28-2015. hml  Return on warrant scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on May 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Defendant to test clean before release from jail.

-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
